For everyone with problem, try editing the batch file and change the REGEDIT near the end (third line from end of file) to just REG.

Also, 64 bit users, change all
HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Reality Pump\xxxxxxx
to
HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Wow6432Node\Reality Pump\xxxxxxxx

you have to do this change in 6 places.

The game finally started for me after this.

changing REGEDIT in bottom to REG didn't do anything...now it says

 "reg is not recognized as an internal or external command,operable program or batch file"

wtf...

here's the batch file...maybe something is wrong?can someone look over it please?


@echo off
echo.
SET path=%CD%
SET path=%path:\=\\%
> "%Temp%.\regfile.reg" ECHO REGEDIT4
>>"%Temp%.\regfile.reg" ECHO.
>>"%Temp%.\regfile.reg" ECHO [HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Reality Pump\TwoWorlds2]
>>"%Temp%.\regfile.reg" ECHO.
>>"%Temp%.\regfile.reg" ECHO [HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Reality Pump\TwoWorlds2\FileSystem]
>>"%Temp%.\regfile.reg" ECHO "DataPath"="%path%\\"
>>"%Temp%.\regfile.reg" ECHO "OutputDir"="%path%\\"
>>"%Temp%.\regfile.reg" ECHO "AppDataFolder"="%path%\\"
>>"%Temp%.\regfile.reg" ECHO "MyDocumentsFolder""%path%\\"
>>"%Temp%.\regfile.reg" ECHO "UseSavedGamesFolder"=dword:00000002
>>"%Temp%.\regfile.reg" ECHO "Version"="1.0.0"
>>"%Temp%.\regfile.reg" ECHO "LanguageVersion"="ENG"
>>"%Temp%.\regfile.reg" ECHO.
>>"%Temp%.\regfile.reg" ECHO [HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Reality Pump\TwoWorlds2\Installer]
>>"%Temp%.\regfile.reg" ECHO "UninstallFolder"="%path%\\"
>>"%Temp%.\regfile.reg" ECHO "PFTree"=dword:00000001
>>"%Temp%.\regfile.reg" ECHO "SMTree"=dword:00000002
>>"%Temp%.\regfile.reg" ECHO "StartMenuGroup"="Reality Pump\\Two Worlds II"
>>"%Temp%.\regfile.reg" ECHO.
>>"%Temp%.\regfile.reg" ECHO [HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Reality Pump\TwoWorlds2\Interface]
>>"%Temp%.\regfile.reg" ECHO "EnablePad"=dword:00000001
>>"%Temp%.\regfile.reg" ECHO.
>>"%Temp%.\regfile.reg" ECHO [HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Reality Pump\TwoWorlds2\Network]
>>"%Temp%.\regfile.reg" ECHO "EarthNetMasterServerAddress"="warnet.2-worlds.com"
>>"%Temp%.\regfile.reg" ECHO.
>>"%Temp%.\regfile.reg" ECHO [HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Reality Pump\TwoWorlds2\SerialKey]
>>"%Temp%.\regfile.reg" ECHO "BuySerialKeyWebsite"="https://secure.zuxxez.com/shop/" 
cls
regedit /s "%Temp%.\regfile.reg" >nul
"%windir%\regedit.exe" /s "%Temp%.\regfile.reg" >nul
del /F /Q "%Temp%.\regfile.reg" >nul

SOLVED

I have had the problem with Two Worlds II repeatedly asking for the serial nearly every time its run.
Its disabled in the Firewall.
This DOESN'T happen if my Internet Connection is switched off.

I've decided that the game looks for a active Internet connection  & try's to verify the Serial.
If it doesn't find an active connection then it excepts the Serial as OK.
That is, it rejects the Serial just because it can' t verify it when the Game thinks it should be able to.
The only solution I have found that works & completely stops the activation requests is 
to edit Windows HOSTS file adding the entry 
"127.0.0.1       secure.zuxxez.com" 
Just disabling TWII in the Firewall isn't enough.

You will have to Google around about working with that HOSTS file ...to complicated to detail here. @@@@
